# Task

Given a DataFrame `df` with column `dt` representing DateTimes. Write a function `add_yearmonth` that creates a new column `ym` by extracting year and month from `dt` and concatenating them together as an integer in format: “yyyymm”.



# Data

df = DataFrame(dt=[DateTime(2020, 5, 24), DateTime(2021, 1, 15), DateTime(2022, 12, 5)])
add_yearmonth(df)

You can use the `year` and `month` functions from the DataFrames.jl package to extract the year and month from a DateTime object, respectively. Then convert them into a string in the desired format (“yyyymm”), and finally add it as a new column to your DataFrame. 

Here is how you can do this:

```julia
using DataFrames, Dates

function add_yearmonth(df::DataFrame)
    df[:ym] = map(x -> string(year(x), lpad(month(x),2,"0")), df.dt)
    return df
end

df = DataFrame(dt=[DateTime(2020, 5, 24), DateTime(2021, 1, 15), DateTime(2022, 12, 5)])
add_yearmonth(df)
```

This will output:

| dt               | ym   |
|-----------------|------|
| 2020-05-24T00:00:00 | 202005 |
| 2021-01-15T00:00:00 | 202101 |
| 2022-12-05T00:00:00 | 202212 |
